Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski with amendments. Without written report.

By Senator Murkowski from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report. Report No. 104-377.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Parks, Historic Preservation, and Recreation

official_title: A bill to amend Public Law 100-479 to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to assist in the construction of a building to be used jointly by the Secretary for park purposes and by the city of Natchez as an intermodal transportation center, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of the Interior to enter into an agreement to pay specified funds toward the planning and construction by the city of Natchez, Mississippi, of a building to be used by the Secretary as an administrative headquarters and visitors' center for the Natchez National Historical Park and by the city as an intermodal transportation center. Directs the Secretary, before executing such agreement, to enter into a 50-year contract with the city providing for gratuitous use and occupancy of the structure (except for maintenance, utility, and other operational costs), with an option for renewal for an additional 50 years. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to amend Public Law 100-479 to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to assist in the construction of a building to be used jointly by the Secretary for park purposes and by the city of Natchez as an intermodal transportation center, and for other purposes.
